use_compression.label: Enable Compression? (yes/no)
use_compression.comment: If enabled, all your XML Sitemaps will be compressed using gzip to reduce your bandwidth consumption. Don't worry, this is 100% Search Engine friendly.

category_filter.label: Category Filter Selector
category_filter.comment: Exclude Categories and its Products (Products is excluded only if belong exclusively to the excluded Categories selection)

divide_by.label: Divide by:
divide_by.comment: If enabled, each group of product will have its own XML sitemap file on the base of it's 'manufacturer' attribute value or category association. ( for ex.: sitemap_prod_manufacturer_1.xml will contains all products where 'manufacturer' value id is '1')
divide_by.tooltip: Note: If you select divide "by Category": The product URL will contain category path only if it has been enabled under Catalog > Search Engine Optimization. Also, the number of product URLs could appear to be higher than the actual number of products. If a product is present in 5 categories, the url will be counted 5 times - once under each category.

product_link_type.label: Product Link Type
product_link_type.comment:
'Category path' is used in XML sitemap only if it has been enabled under Catalog > Search Engine Optimization.

NOTE: 'Canonical' is the only option on EE 1.13 and higher (other settings are not fully compatible)
product_link_type.tooltip: Note: Use of canonical meta tag for product pages is recommended if you are using category path. Also, if you are using categories path for product url, the total number of URLs will be higher than the total number of products (single product may be present in multiple categories).

use_root_catalog.label: Use 'Catalog Root' filter
use_root_catalog.comment: Filter your product by 'Store View' scope ('Category Root').
use_root_catalog.tooltip: Magento Catalog is based on Website scope. In case you have organized your catalog on Store View scope, using 'Catelog root' option will filter your products by 'Store View'.

path_map.label: PathMap
path_map.comment: Default value: empty. 'Relative Path' for the sub-root: use this setting only for Multi-Domain site that uses a different Root for every Domain/Store.
path_map.tooltip: In case of multi-domain Magento setup, give the location where extension has to create the files for sitemap. Populate with the relative path between your main Magento Root and the sub-root folder ( ex. '../SubRoot/', './SubRoot/' ).

parse_robots.label: Parse Robots.txt
parse_robots.comment: Exclude URLs disallowed by Robots.txt rules.

check_orphan.label: Check For Orphan products.
check_orphan.comment: Check for products that are not assigned to any category.

debug_check_excluded.label: Check for not fetched Prod (Debug Mode)
debug_check_excluded.comment: (very slow) - Use this feature only for debug purpose: check for products that are not fetched during sitemap generation.

use_pagination.comment: Use only if you have issue during sitemap generation (ex. MySql Connection Lost error)

add_excluded_images.label: Add "Excluded Images"
add_excluded_images.comment: Include/exclude "Excluded Images" from product gallery in XML Sitemap.
add_excluded_images.tooltip: If enabled, product images marked as "Excluded" at path Catalog > Product > Edit Product > Images will be added to product image sitemap.

license_type.label: Image License Url
license_type.comment:
Select 'No License Inf' if you don't want to add any licence info to your Image Sitemap.
Creative Commons License Info

enabled.label: Enable
enabled.comment: Include/exclude category pages in XML Sitemap.
enabled.tooltip: If enabled, an XML sitemap containing only 'category' page urls will be generated. Once generated, this XML sitemap filename will be appended with '_cat' to help you identify that this sitemap has 'category' page urls in it.

enabled_realdate.label: Use real update date
enabled_realdate.comment: If you select 'yes' the date when the page was updated will be used else the current date will be used.

changefreq.label: Frequency (Optional)
changefreq.comment: How frequently is the content on the category pages likely to change?
changefreq.tooltip: This value is only a hint to Search Engines and may not correlate exactly to how often search engines crawl the category pages.

priority.label: Priority (Optional)
priority.comment: The valid range is from 0.0 to 1.0, with 1.0 being the most important.
priority.tooltip: This indicates priority of your category pages relative to all the other pages on the site to Search Engines. Assigning a high priority to all the pages will not help your site's search ranking.

js.comment:
<script type='text/javascript'>

    function addEventObserver(groupId,selectId){
        $$('#'+groupId+' table').each(function(el) {
            el.observe('mouseover', function(ev) {
                fixTooltip(selectId);
            });
        });
        $(selectId).observe('focus', function(ev) {
            fixTooltip(selectId);
        });

        $(selectId).observe('blur', function(ev) {
            fixTooltip(selectId);
        });
    }
    function fixTooltip(selectId){
        var tooltipId = 'row_'+selectId+'_comment';
        var isEnabled = $(selectId).value;

        if (isEnabled == '0'){
            $(tooltipId).setStyle({
            'height': '100%'
            });
        }
    }

 </script> 

                                <script type='text/javascript'>

var groupId = 'sitemapEnhancedPlus_category';
var jsRowId = 'tr#row_'+groupId+'_js';
var selectId = groupId+'_enabled';

hideFields(jsRowId);
addEventObserver(groupId,selectId);

</script>

cron_status.label: Magento Cron Job (on server)
cron_status.comment: If it's 'Not running' then please contact your server team to set it up else automatic sitemap generation will not work.
cron_status.tooltip: This status is calculated based on the time difference between current time and the last run time for cron. If it's less than an hour then status reflected is 'Running' else 'Not Running'.

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.comment: If enabled, your XML sitemap(s) will get generated / updated automatically at the time specified below.
enabled.tooltip: Warning: Please select a time when your store sees low traffic (for example 03:00:00). Sitemap generation process consumes bandwidth and may result in server overload or slow speed, if your server gets overwhelmed. You must consult your server administrator for server resource availability and the best time for auto-generation of XML Sitemaps.

frequency.comment: How frequently you would like the XML Sitemap to be generated? More info here

report_email.comment: Each time the sitemap is generated, we will email an information summary of sitemap generation to the specified email Id(s). Each value must be separated by semicolon (<label style="color:red;font-weight:bold;">;</label>)

enabled.comment: We automatically ping search engines to index your XML sitemap(s) each time it's generated or updated. However, this doesn't ensure indexing. We strongly recommend that you submit/update the index sitemap to Google & Bing Webmaster Account.
